s/p PCI, no response to aggressive diuresis overnight. Hx of basline
CKD related to DM2 as well as history of contrast nephropathy.  FeNa
and FeUrea are both consistent with ATN
- Consult renal this AM for consideration of HD given respiratory
- Will trial higher dose lasix with diuril 500mg IV and lasix 200mg IV,

disase, s/p BMS x 2.  Patient's typical anginal pain was occuring at
rest and had ST depressions in V4-6.  Currently chest pain free.

- hold [**Last Name (un) 284**] given large dye load in cath lab
- holding BB given low BP and need for nitro gtt  (for CHF, not CP)

breath was exacerbated by PRBC transfusions and now renal failure

to cath vs GI bleed from external hemorrhoid. Repeat HCT was decreased

- Transfuse for HCT< 21 give risks of hypervolemia
- Holding off on tapping likely bilat hemothoraces for now. [**Name (NI) 4434**]

6. Electrolyte imbalances, including hyperkalemia and hypokalemia.
7. Metabolic acidosis, including lactic acidosis and ketoacidosis.
